==Japanese==
{{ja-kanjitab|じょう|ふ|yomi=on}}

===Etymology===
Probably from {{etyl|ltc|ja|sort=しょうふ'}} compound {{m|ltc|情婦|tr=*dzhiɛng *bhiǒu}}. Compare modern {{etyl|zh|-}} traditional {{m|zh|情婦}} and simplified {{m|zh|情妇|tr=qíngfù}}.

===Pronunciation===
* {{l|ja|sc=Latn|音読み|On'yomi}}
* {{ja-accent-common|a|じょ|うふ}}<ref name="DJR">{{R:Daijirin}}</ref>
* {{IPA|lang=ja|[d͡ʑʲo̞ːɸɯᵝ]}}

===Noun===
{{ja-noun|じょうふ}}

# {{lb|ja|sort=しょうふ'|dated}} a female [[lover]], a female [[fling]], a [[mistress]]

====Usage notes====
Specifically refers to an [[extramarital]] female [[lover]].<ref name="KDJ">{{R:Kokugo Dai Jiten}}</ref>

Somewhat dated overtones. Often used to refer to a [[criminal]]'s or [[player]]'s lover;<ref name="KDJ"/> compare English {{m|en|moll}}.

====Synonyms====
* {{ja-l|隠し女|かくしおんな|kakushi onna}}: literally ''[[hidden]] [[woman]]''
* {{ja-l|色女|いろおんな|iro onna}}: literally ''"[[colorful]]" [[woman]]'' {{qualifier|alluding to a sexual relationship}}
* {{ja-l|愛人|あいじん|aijin}}: a [[lover]] {{qualifier|often, but not necessarily, refers to an extramarital relationship}}

====Related terms====
* {{ja-l|情夫|じょうふ|jōfu}}: a male [[lover]], a male [[fling]] {{qualifier|specifically refers to an extramarital male lover}}
